metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3484 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the __dn_expand function innetwork/dn_expand.c in musl libc 1.1x before 1.1.2 and 0.9.13 through 1.0.3allow remote attackers to (1) have unspecified impact via an invalid namelength in a DNS response or (2) cause a denial of service (crash) via aninvalid name length in a DNS response, related to an infinite loop with nooutput.

criterions.comment: musl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
